topic.title: Disabled benchmarking in MultiUser
topic.body:
The Benchmarking function is CPU intensive, so someone could easily DOS
a proxy.

Pointed out in:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1LJP7tDoGnWNppUGJoNS8cJbmYTS1TecCC/Zero+proxies+vulnerability

topic.title: Only update if revision online is newer
topic.body: To fix issue #605 it will only update ZeroNet if a newer version is available online.

topic.title: Gratipay shut down so removing
topic.body:
Gratipay shut down so people can't donate to the project through it
anymore.

1604065292_mirrored_TheNain38_github.body: @icf20 The problem with that is not many people have Bitcoin. Zeronet is very noob friendly so you should not expect many people using it to have Bitcoin or even know how to get it. Also a spammer could have a Bitcoin balance and once it has been detected as spamming they could just launder their Bitcoins and spam again.

1604065498_mirrored_shirishag75_github.body:
This would be pretty easy to implement, you could just download the [/src/Config.py](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/master/src/Config.py) and get the revision (or version) number to compare to the current number.

You can easily get the revision number with Regex e.g `"(?<=self.rev = )\d+"` (so no external libraries are needed) however there would probably be a better way of doing it.
@shirishag75 I contributed a patch but as I said there is probably a better way of doing it, although it works fine so you can use it now.

1604065504_mirrored_majestrate_github.body:
```
test_addresses = ["127.0.0.1", "128.0.0.1", "10.0.0.1", "127.34354.0.1"]
for address in test_addresses:
    print("IP address {:<13} returns :{}".format(address, is_private_address(address)))
```

Returns

```
IP address 127.0.0.1     returns :True
IP address 128.0.0.1     returns :False
IP address 10.0.0.1      returns :True
IP address 127.34354.0.1 returns :True
```

The last one should not return True, see http://stackoverflow.com/a/11264379 for more info.

1604067608_mirrored_ZeroNetTickBot_githu.body: I only did 1 trivial commit so I don't think I should have a say. I am just commenting so you can cross me off.
